name: Inn on Main Street B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought I already reviewed the Inn on Main Street but it doesn't show up. Sorry, Dan and Nancy! We loved staying here. Dan cooks enormous delicious breakfasts - Different and tasty each morning. Nancy is very warm and helpful. They both helped us with things to do and places to go. There are many fine restaurants within walking distance. It's nice to be out of the hustle and bustle of Asheville and relax at "home." The room is very comfortable. The bed was great - I slept very well. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Beware enormous breakfasts!

reviews.text: We stayed for two evenings but how I wish it were many more! The inn was so adorable and perfect! The room was wonderful with a jacuzzi tub, warm robes, and a chocolate treat! Breakfast both mornings was fatastic with so much to enjoy! We had Biltmore tickets and a soak at the hot springs and a massage all scheduled by the inn! The owners Dan and Nancy were so kind and inviting that I felt at home! I loved my stay and would do it again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Quaint stay
Great room and wonderful hospitality!
reviews.text: Our stay was very comfortable and "quiet", which was what we were looking for. The breakfast was wonderful. Dan and Nancy were very helpful and made us feel comfortable. I believe this was our first bed and breakfast experience and it was really enjoyable.

We had the opportunity to stay in two rooms during our visit, the Lee Room and the Monroe Room. We wanted to stay two nights but the first room was only available one night, so we needed to move to a second room which gave us the opportunity to check out the first and the second floor of the main building. Both rooms were comfortable. The fireplace in the Lee Room is perfect for chilly nights and mornings. The Monroe Room was bright and had a good view. The breakfasts were wonderful and hearty, which was important given we had a full day of activities both days. Dan and Nancy were fantastic hosts and the guests were very friendly. Just a note of caution, as you pull into the driveway, be careful to stay to the right so as not to scrap the curb on the left! Some fantastic restaurants in Weaverville!
reviews.title: Very Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a nice time. Warm, beautiful, inviting home. We took a package deal that included a soak at the natural hot springs about a half hour away and a massage which was wonderful. Dan and Nancy were super informative and helpful on everything from local attractions to the best restaurants and even spent time just having casual conversation which was plus. Wife and I can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Inn on Main B&B

description: A romantic and eco-friendly Victorian getaway near Asheville and the Biltmore Estate in quiet, artsy Weaverville. Enjoy mountain views during breakfast on the porch. Walk to restaurants, galleries and a scenic mountain lake. Near golf, hiking, rafting, natural hot mineral baths and world-class canopy tour. Seven rooms with private baths, most with fireplaces and some with whirlpool tubs. We accommodate vegan, diabetic, and gluten-free diets. All breakfasts and evening refreshments are made from scratch using ingredients from our organic gardens. Spa, Biltmore and adventure specials.
